alert.note: Alert for North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 17 at 3:43AM MDT until March 17 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...AREAS OF HEAVY SNOW THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... .Widespread light to moderate snow will continue over the region this morning. The heaviest snowfall this morning will be focused over the Palmer Divide south of Denver and the foothills west of Denver. Roads may become snowpacked or icy for the this morning`s commute, especially in areas west and south of Denver. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination safely. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT TODAY... * WHAT...Snow ongoing. Additional snow accumulations between 1 and 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Limon, and Southern Lincoln County. * WHEN...Until Noon MDT today. * IMPACTS...Roads will be slushy and slick. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination safely.
info.instruction: Roads will be slick resulting in slow and hazardous travel. Allow extra time to reach your destination.

area.areaDesc: North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County
